fact_list.fact_text: An unbroken yellow line indicates no parking between 7.00am and 7.00pm on that side of the road where the line is drawn, except on Sundays and public holidays.
Unbroken double yellow lines indicate no parking at all times on that side of the road where these lines are drawn, except for the immediate picking up and letting down of passengers.
A single yellow zig-zag line indicates No Parking at all times on that side of the road where the line is drawn, except for the immediate picking up and letting down of passengers.
Violation of the no parking rule on unbroken double yellow lines attracts demerit points and a fine.
Double yellow zig-zag lines indicate No Stopping at all times on that side of the road where the lines are drawn.
Violation of the no stopping rule on double yellow zig-zag lines attracts demerit points and a fine.
A broken white line at an accelerating lane indicates the edge of a road adjacent to an accelerating lane.
A broken white line at a decelerating lane indicates the edge of a road adjacent to a turning or decelerating lane.
